diagnoses.name: Migraine with Aura
diagnoses.description: A type of headache that is often accompanied by visual disturbances (scotoma), sensitivity to sound (phonophobia), and sometimes numbness or tingling.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune condition affecting the central nervous system, leading to symptoms such as numbness, weakness, balance issues (ataxia), and sometimes visual problems.

diagnoses.name: Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA)
diagnoses.description: Often called a mini-stroke, it can cause temporary symptoms similar to a stroke, including numbness, ataxia, and visual disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Brain Tumor
diagnoses.description: Tumors in the brain can press on nerve tissues and cause various symptoms including ataxia, numbness, and changes in vision.

diagnoses.name: Stroke
diagnoses.description: A condition where the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted, leading to symptoms like numbness, ataxia, and in some cases, vision problems.

diagnoses.name: Basilar-Type Migraine
diagnoses.description: A rare form of migraine that can cause ataxia, phonophobia, and visual disturbances, along with other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Meningitis
diagnoses.description: Inflammation of the brain and spinal cord membranes, potentially causing numbness, ataxia, and in severe cases, vision problems.

diagnoses.name: Vestibular Neuronitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the vestibular nerve that can cause severe vertigo, ataxia, and in some cases, auditory disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Toxic Exposure
diagnoses.description: Exposure to toxic substances can affect the nervous system, leading to symptoms such as numbness, ataxia, and visual disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Ataxias
diagnoses.description: A group of genetic disorders that affect coordination and movement, leading to symptoms such as ataxia, and in some cases, numbness and visual disturbances.
